**Schedule: Monday – Friday 9:00am -5:30pm and 1 Saturday per month**

**Supervisor:** Chief Medical Officer

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Job Type:** Full-Time

**FLSA:** Exempt

**Salary:** $125,000 - $140,000


Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, and mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support, and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents.

 **BCHN’s mission** is to improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes. Within this area, Health Center sites focus on the low-income and underserved populations.

  

We are seeking a Nurse Practitioner to provide evidence-based Primary Care to our patients. The ideal candidate is a Family Nurse Practitioner with various medical specialties.

**About the Role:** The Nurse Practitioner (NP) is responsible for providing high quality care to adult and pediatric patients and their families. The NP will work closely with a team of professionals to provide a comprehensive patient-centered plan of care to achieve expected outcomes.

* Provides primary medical care to patients and manages acute and chronic conditions.
* Conduct age-appropriate assessments of patients, including history taking and physical examination in accordance with current standards of professional practice, regulatory requirements and agency policies and procedures.
* Perform assessment/data collection in an ongoing systematic manner, focusing on physiological, psychosocial, cultural, spiritual, and cognitive status, patient/family education, family involvement, and patient advocacy.
* Conduct age-appropriate assessments of patients, including history taking and physical examination in accordance with current standards of professional practice, regulatory requirements and agency policies and procedures.
* Works continually to assure deliverance of quality clinical care in a safe, efficient, competent, and effective manner.
* Refer to other clinicians as clinically appropriate.
* Prepares records and reports as required in support of services rendered in accordance with established procedures.
* Maintains accurate and detailed medical records about each patient, including observations during examinations (via EMR)
* Administers or prescribes treatments and medications.
* Promotes health by advising patients concerning diet, hygiene, and methods for prevention of disease.
* Writes orders to inoculate and vaccinate patients to immunize patients from communicable diseases.
* Collaborate with physicians and other clinicians to assure effective patient care consistent with quality indicators for patients cared for in the designated service.
* Responsible for maintaining confidentiality of all patients, clients, proprietary, and protected information.
* Participate in patient care conferences, professional staff conferences, and other appropriate professional activities related to his/her assigned by the CMO.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Qualifications:**

* Board Certification
* Current N.Y.S. License as Nurse Practitioner
* Bachelor’s degree (Required)
* Completion of a Master’s Program in Adult NP, Family Practice NP (Preferred)
* Current active DEA license.
* Basic Life Support certification or willing to obtain.
* 1-year related experience with adult population in a clinic setting.
* 2 years related experience with Pediatric population in a clinic setting.

**Special Skills and Knowledge:**

* Experience working in community-based health care settings is also preferred.
* Experience/An understanding of EMRs is helpful
* The ability to demonstrate teamwork and effective interpersonal relations skills
* Excellent written/oral communication and computer skills
* Ability to foster and maintain a positive working relationship in a multidisciplinary team and clients.
* Great bedside manners.
* Up-to-date knowledge of the latest technologies and treatments.

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN):** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, and mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support, and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents. **BCHN mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.

**About the Role**: The Manager of Clinical Informatics is responsible for all computer application training for staff. This individual will continuously improve the value of information by ensuring that data and content are accurate, reliable, up-to-date, consistent, and meaningful to end users. Health informatics specialists analyze health data and optimize the delivery of healthcare services in collaboration with healthcare providers. They gather pertinent healthcare data, develop effective information systems and procedures and supply healthcare providers with access to shared information.

* Ensure that personal health information and business information are available only to authorized users.
* Develop a EMR-related workflows and train others how software applications are used to support it.
* Collaborate with end users to understand requirements and work processes that can be improved using information technology.
* Anticipate and recognize when technology changes have a high impact on the organization and assist with change management to maximize benefits and minimize operational disruption.
* Assist with troubleshooting software, equipment, access, and user problems.
* Create training materials and application testing.
* Perform data and statistical analysis as requested.
* Performs other duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in healthcare, human services, public health, information systems, healthcare informatics, or similar field of study. Master’s degree preferred.
* 3-5 years of clinical informatics experience in a clinic or healthcare setting or at least five years of experience in healthcare management, healthcare related experience in database management, data collection, and statistical analysis creating and using reports in multiple electronic medical records management system
* High level of competency with computer software. (Required)
* Certified Professional in Health Information and Management Systems (CPHIMS)

**Special Skills, and Knowledge:**

* Deep expertise with modern Electronic Health Record Systems.
* Must have strong analytical skills along with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent attention to detail.
* Experience with population health and data management and analysis.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, relational databases, and spreadsheets.
* Ability to collaborate and work well as part of a team.

Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, and mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support, and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents.

 **BCHN’s mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes. Within this area, Health Center sites focus on the low-income and underserved populations.

  

BCHN is seeking to hire an Enrollment Specialist to help patients’ complete insurance applications and enroll in a plan.

**About the Role:** The Enrollment Specialist will effectively communicate coverage information to patients, and interpret complex information, including processes, procedures, and legal/regulatory requirements. Responsible for performing various data entry functions.

* Assisting patients in understanding insurance choices, federal tax subsidies, public plans, plan benefits, co-payment and other cost-sharing expenses
* Completing enrollment process for clients, following case from initial file set-up to completion
* Educating consumers on their benefits and responsibilities under Affordable Care Act
* Contacting NY State of Health to resolve issues, as needed.
* Facilitating selection of a qualified health plan to consumers who are applying for health insurance coverage at the time of application and at renewals.
* Assuring that all applications are accurately completed and submitted on time, adhering to current submission guidelines.
* Meeting productivity and quality performance targets
* Performing services in a culturally competent manner, considering individual needs with regard to language, disability access, and reading level
* Referring consumers to other organizations for help with grievances, complaints, or questions regarding health coverage or a determination related to coverage.
* Maintaining strict confidentiality and privacy standards
* Ability to successfully execute multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Follow best practice and clinical standards and adhere to departmental and NY State guidelines.
* Support the Health Center administrative goals and requirements.
* Checks and verifies that all documents are complete and ready for submission.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma or GED (Required)

BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes.

**BCHN mission**: To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.


BCHN is seeking a full-time Registered Nurse who will be a key member of the health care team covering different centers, providing support to health providers in addressing the health care needs of patients. The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses, or disabilities.

**About the Role**: The Registered Nurse (RN) is responsible for providing care to patients within the center as directed by the medical staff. Their duties include communicating with doctors and other Registered Nurses about patient needs, administering immunizations and medications appropriate and using medical equipment to monitor patient’s vital signs and perform point of care testing as indicated.

* Observe and record patient behavior.
* Perform patient assessments and diagnostic tests.
* Collect patient health history and triage acutely ill patients.
* Counsel and educate patients and their families on treatment plans.
* Provide patient education for chronic disease self-management.
* Administer medication, change wound dressings, and provide self-care instruction.

* Direct and supervise nurses, medical assistants.

* Maintains nursing competence through participation in continuing professional education and other appropriate learning experience.
* Works assigned shifts at locations other than primary assigned work site, when necessary, as deemed by management and in accordance with BCHN Policy.
* Performs other duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications and Skills**

* Experience 1-4 years as an RN
* Bachelor’s Degree (Required).
* RN License (Current New York State License Required)
* Bilingual English & Spanish (Preferred)

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:**

* Good computer skills
* Good time management and organization
* Able to analyze, review and judge different situations and take the right actions according to the situation.
* Ability to walk and stand for long periods of time; ability to lift and move patients.

title: Dentist
description:
**Bronx Community Health Network**

**Job Description**

**Job Title:** Dentist

**Schedule:** 9:00am – 5:00pm Monday – Friday and 1 Saturday per month

**Supervisor:** Chief Medical Officer

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Job Type:** Full-Time

**FLSA:** Exempt

**Salary:** $165,000 - $180,000


Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, and mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support, and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents.

 **BCHN’s mission** is to improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services. BCHN’s service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes. Within this area, Health Center sites focus on the low-income and underserved populations.

**About the Role:** The Dentist is responsible for delivering quality and comprehensive dental care, such as routine procedures like fillings, extractions, root canals, scaling and polishing, as well as more complex treatments. To maintain the overall health of the patient in support of the mission of BCHN.

* Provides comprehensive dental care to patients of all ages in accordance to ADA standards and guidelines.
* Perform routine dental examinations including x-rays, screenings, and assessments of oral health.
* Consistent with BCHN goals and other regulatory mandates, maintain a roster of scheduled dental patients and treat dental emergencies (walk-in-patients) when available.
* Prepare patients for treatment (by applying oral sedation or anesthesia)
* Check teeth, gums, and other parts of the mouth, along with X-rays and tests, to diagnose dental problems.
* Practice accepted infection control measures in accordance with the OSHA Bloodborne Pathogens Standard, and BCHN policies and procedures.
* Diagnose and treat oral diseases, injuries, and abnormalities.
* Develop and implement treatment plans tailored to each patient’s needs, including restorative preventive and therapeutic procedures.
* Design and fit dental prosthetics, such as bridges, crowns, and dentures.
* Conduct tooth extractions and root canal procedures.
* Perform dental procedures such as fillings, extractions, root canals and periodontal procedures as indicated.
* Educate patients on proper oral hygiene practices, preventive care, and the importance of regular dental visits.
* Follow all established guidelines in accordance with state and federal laws and regulations.
* Complete Performance Appraisals and Competency Evaluations for dental support staff under his/her supervision on an annual basis and as needed.
* Refer patients to specialists as needed for further evaluation and treatment.
* Assist in completing insurance forms, dental completion forms, and any other forms that patients require.
* Contribute to the development of policies and standards of patient care by participating in committees.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Qualifications:**

* Three (3) years’ experience and high competency in clinical dentistry.
* Degree from accredited dental school (DDS or DMD)
* Commitment to and knowledge of community dental health care.
* Current license to practice in New York State (Required)
* Doctorate or better (Required)
* Experience with Athena Health EMR is helpful. (Preferred)
* DEA Controlled Substances Registration Certificate.

**Special Skills and Knowledge:**

* Up-to-date knowledge of the latest technologies and treatments.
* Strong computer skills required.
* Demonstrates the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patient served.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to maintain detailed documentation and records in an organized manner. Work as a team member and independently.
* Ability to foster and maintain a positive working relationship in a multidisciplinary team and clients.

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high quality and comprehensive health care services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. description:
**Bronx Community Health Network**

**Job Description**

**Job Title:** Reg. Dietician/Nutritionist

**Schedule:** Monday – Friday 9:00am – 5:30pm

**Supervisor:** Chief Medical Officer

**Department**: Clinical Administration

**Job Type:** Full-Time 37.5 hours weekly

**FLSA:** Exempt

**Salary:** $70,000 - $90,000


Come join our amazing team of dedicated healthcare workers!

**Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN)** was founded in 1996 to ensure that the socio-economically depressed and medically underserved residents of the Bronx have access to high-quality and comprehensive healthcare services, Bronx Community Health Network (BCHN) is a not-for-profit, community-based organization and Federally Qualified Health Center. The organization provides a wide range of comprehensive, coordinated primary medical, oral, mental health care and related diagnostic, pharmacy, social support and enabling services for medically underserved/uninsured residents. BCHN service area includes the entire borough of the Bronx, including all 25 zip codes.

 **BCHN mission:** To improve the health of people and families in the Bronx; provide access to affordable, quality health care, especially for uninsured persons; promote disease prevention, early treatment and healthful lifestyles; and obtain financial and other resources for programs and services.

  

BCHN is seeking to hire a Dietician/Nutritionist to establish short and long-term health goals with patients, teaching the patients and the community about health and nutrition and developing effective nutritional exercise plans for patients or individuals in the community.

**About the Role:** The Dietician/Nutritionist is responsible for providing nutritional services to patients, which includes counseling, nutritional assessments, prescriptions, and evaluation of nutritional-related lab parameters, as part of a member of the team to improve results and maximize outcomes.

* Provides quality, comprehensive care for patients with chronic condition or the risk of chronic conditions, through individual consultations and group classes.
* Assess patient’s needs (nutritional, psychosocial, environmental, self-care, educational needs, and home needs). Adjust intensity of service based on needs, and appropriate utilization of resources.
* Develop patient centered plan of care based on individualized patient needs.
* Utilize motivational interviewing, goal setting strategies and SMART goal development to promote realistic and successful behavior change.
* Uses self-management-training techniques, assess, plan, and implement patient and family education in an individual and/or group setting. Education includes but is not limited to healthy eating, physical activity, self-monitoring, taking medications, and coping skills.
* Evaluate the effectiveness of educational process toward achieving self-management. Refer when appropriate.
* Identifies available community resources helpful to patients, refers and assists patients in utilizing such resources.
* Provides telehealth services to patients as appropriate.
* Completes documentation of patient status, plan of care, and progress.
* Demonstrates ability to interpret and maintain patient and site data.
* Participates in quality improvement activities, attending department meetings, etc.
* Collaborates with all care team members in planning and delivering appropriate patient care.
* Speak to groups about the importance of nutrition to prevent specific diseases.
* Create educational material about healthy eating habits.
* Responsible for staying updated on regular health trends and diets to ensure they’re providing valuable guidance and advice to patients.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**Qualifications:**

* NYS Licensed as a Dietician
* Bachelor’s degree in Dietetics-Nutrition or similar field required.
* 2-3 years’ experience in related field
* Must have extensive knowledge of child nutrition, and chronic disease management including but not limited to diabetes, obesity, and high cholesterol.

**Special Skills and Knowledge:**

* Strong computer skills required.
* Ability to maintain detailed documentation and records in an organized manner. Work as a team member and independently.
* Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.
* Basic knowledge of medical terminology
* Excellent active listening skills and strong service orientation

***Clean Team / Housekeeping Team -*** The Clean Team is responsible for the overall cleanliness, upkeep and operational safety of The Fort Athletic Club (The Fort). Working alongside the Facilities and Operations Managers, the Clean Team follows a daily list of to-dos to be completed as a group to ensure the health and safety of all staff and members.

*Responsibilities:*

* Perform duties typically associated with janitorial or custodial roles such as, but not limited to, cleaning and disinfecting equipment, laundry service, sweeping, trash removal, vacuuming and mopping floors, wiping down mirrors and windows, cleaning bathrooms and all other areas of the facility
* Ensure that all products and materials are fully stocked. Report to management when low inventory orders should be placed.

 *Schedule:*

title: Group Training
description:
**Earn Your Stripes Coach**

  

Are you ready to join the ranks of elite fitness professionals? Fort AC is seeking a passionate and experienced individual to fill the role of Earn Your Stripes (EYS) Coach. As an EYS Coach, you will embody the pinnacle of fitness excellence, drawing upon your battle-tested expertise to lead our members to new heights of physical and mental performance.


Primary Responsibilities:

  

* Deliver Unique Workouts: Craft and deliver uniquely branded workouts designed to push members beyond their limits, both physically and mentally. This includes leading our signature program Earn Your Stripe, a four-station workout experience that combines Strength, Power, Endurance, and Functional stations, as well as EYS Combat, a 50-minute, 12-round program that combines the principles of boxing and strength training to challenge members' endurance and strength.

  

* Leadership and Coaching: Lead, coach, and command the training room with authority and expertise, creating an unparalleled experience that motivates and challenges our members.

  

* Drive Utilization: Create an atmosphere that drives member utilization by delivering high-energy, results-driven workouts that keep members coming back for more.

  

* Fitness Expertise: Serve as a fitness expert, providing guidance, support, and motivation to help members achieve their fitness goals.

  

* Brand Ambassadorship: Represent the Fort AC brand with pride and enthusiasm, embodying our core values and commitment to excellence in every interaction.

  

* Team Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with other team members to ensure the overall success and performance of the studio.

title: Trainers
description:
Boxing Coach

**Job Title:** Boxing Coach - Mittwork Specialist

**Location:** The Fort Athletic Club

**Job Type:** [Part-Time/Contract]

**About Us:** The Fort Athletic Club is dedicated to providing top-notch boxing training and fitness solutions for individuals of all levels. We are seeking a skilled Boxing Coach with a strong foundation in basic boxing skills, specializing in mitt work, to join our team and lead dynamic mittwork-focused classes as well as provide personalized private training sessions.

**Job Summary:** The Boxing Coach will be responsible for leading group classes and private training sessions with a focus on mitt work. The ideal candidate will possess a solid understanding of fundamental boxing techniques and the ability to effectively communicate and demonstrate these skills to clients. The role involves creating engaging and challenging workouts that help clients improve their boxing skills, enhance their fitness, and achieve their personal goals.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Class Instruction:**


	+ Design and lead mittwork-focused group classes, ensuring each session is engaging, challenging, and tailored to the skill levels of participants.
	+ Provide clear instructions and demonstrations of boxing techniques, emphasizing proper form and safety.
* **Private Training:**


	+ Conduct one-on-one boxing sessions, focusing on mitt work and other fundamental boxing skills based on individual client needs and goals.
	+ Develop personalized training plans and track clients’ progress to help them achieve their objectives.
* **Client Engagement:**


	+ Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, offering encouragement and constructive feedback to foster their development.
	+ Address any client concerns or questions related to their training and progress.
* **Equipment Management:**


	+ Ensure all training equipment, particularly mitts and pads, are in good condition and ready for use.
	+ Maintain a clean and organized training environment.
* **Continuous Improvement:**


	+ Stay updated with the latest boxing techniques and training methods to continuously enhance your coaching skills.
	+ Participate in professional development opportunities and incorporate new knowledge into training sessions.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a boxing coach or trainer, with a strong emphasis on mitt work.
* Comprehensive knowledge of basic boxing skills, techniques, and conditioning.
* Ability to design and implement effective training programs for both group classes and private sessions.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a talent for motivating and inspiring clients.
* Certification in boxing coaching or a related field is preferred, but not required.
* Current First Aid/CPR certification is a plus.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to demonstrate boxing techniques and actively participate in training sessions.
* Capability to handle physical demands of the job, including demonstrating exercises and moving equipment.

title: Front Desk Attendant
description:
**Job Summary:** As a Front Desk Attendant at The Fort, you will be the first point of contact for members and guests. You will ensure a welcoming and positive experience for everyone entering the facility. This role involves handling inquiries, membership sales, scheduling appointments, and assisting with various administrative tasks to support the smooth operation of the center.

**Responsibilities:**

* Greet members and guests warmly and assist them with check-ins and check-outs.
* Answer phone calls, respond to inquiries, and provide information about the facility and services.
* Handle cash and credit card transactions using the POS system.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the front desk area and lobby.
* Monitor and ensure security protocols are followed, such as checking member IDs and enforcing access policies.
* Assist in resolving member concerns and escalate issues to management when necessary.
* Collaborate with other staff members to ensure excellent customer service and operational efficiency.
* Perform opening and closing duties according to established procedures.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous customer service experience, preferably in a fitness center or hospitality setting.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Proficiency in using computers and basic software applications (e.g., MS Office, email, scheduling software).
* Knowledge of fitness center operations, including membership sales and class scheduling, is a plus.
* CPR/AED certification may be required (training provided if necessary).

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to stand, walk, and lift up to 10 pounds.
* Flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

**Salary**

* $17 - $19 per hour, shift dependent


Includes free Club Membership

title: Before and/or After School Program Supervisor
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is not just another childcare provider. We are Inc. 5,000's fastest-growing provider of Early Learning, Before and After School, and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations and growing. We are a certified benefit corporation on a mission to reinvent accessible and affordable childcare for today’s families and create opportunities for our team to do what they love (and feel valued while doing it). Join our award-winning community and dive into a world of excitement, growth, and endless possibilities. Check out what it's like to work with us at healthykidsprograms.com/workwithus.

**We are looking for passionate and energetic individuals to join our team as part-time Program Supervisors for our Before and After School Program at Grafflin Elementary in Chappaqua, NY.**

**PAY:** $15.75 per hour

**SCHEDULE: 6:30a-8:30a and 1:30p-6:30p**

**JOB STATUS:** Part-time, non-exempt

**JOB CONSISTS OF:**

* Direct hands-on activities following our Healthy Kids Curriculum, covering everything from fitness to STEAM, academic adventures, artsy creations, and more! Oh, and don't forget about helping out with homework.
* Create a safe, healthy, and mega-fun environment where kids can thrive. Be the ultimate role model they'll look up to every single day.
* Assist the Site Director with certain management functions such as accurate attendance records, registration, and staffing and act as the designated person in charge when the Site Director is not on site.
* Provide continual communication with parents and family members via the Brightwheel App, because who doesn't love sharing those precious moments and updates?
* Make sure you're always in the know by following OCFS guidelines, Healthy Kids Extended Day Program policies, and our host school's rules like a pro!
* Regularly meet with the Director to make decisions, solve problems, and strategize on immediate issues.


Requirements:
**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**


A high school diploma or its equivalent; and two years of direct experience working with children under 13 years of age.


OR


A School-age Child Care Credential or other Office recognized credential specific to the school-age developmental period, and one year of experience working with children less than 13 years of age;


OR


Associate’s degree in Child Development, Elementary Education, Physical Education, Recreation, or a related field.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Get ready to ace a background check, including fingerprinting, references, SEL & SCR through NYS Office of Children and Family Services.
* You've got the green light from your doctor - medically fit to rock all the job duties and free of any communicable diseases including TB.
* You’re warm, friendly, and upbeat. Exceptional people skills are your jam, whether it's with kiddos, parents, or fellow team members. Plus, you're professional, reliable, and always prompt.
* You're ready to bend, stretch, lift, carry (up to 50 lbs.), and basically do whatever it takes to keep up with kids!

**PART-TIME PERKS:**

* **On-Demand Pay:** Why wait for payday when you can have your money when you need it?
* **Telehealth Benefits:** Stay healthy and happy with access to virtual care
* **401(k) for eligible employees PLUS a 1% employer match:** Yep, we're serious about your future too!
* **Paid Sick Time Off:** Because everyone needs a break sometimes.
* **Career Development:** Level up your skills and expertise on us!
* **Growth Opportunities:** We’re growing and we need people to grow with us!
* **AFLAC Supplemental Plans:** Because we believe in going above and beyond to take care of our team.
* **Did we mention certain applicants qualify for tuition assistance?** Reach out to us for all the details!

*Healthy Kids is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Healthy Kids Programs makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, visit: healthykidsprograms.com*

title: Associate Director of Inclusive Learning IEP
description:
**About Us:**
Northside Charter High School is a small, public charter school located in the North Williamsburg/ Greenpoint neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York. We are a college preparatory high school with a mission to prepare students for college. Through our unique approach to instruction, we provide scholars in grades 9-12 with an education that results in mastery of the New York State Learning Standards, on-time high school graduation, and readiness to take college courses in high school. The journey we envision for students is to get ready for, go to, and complete the right-fit college or university of their choice.

**Our Core Values are:*** Commitment
* Accountability
* Respect
* Integrity

**About the Role:**


Northside Charter High School is seeking an organized, flexible, and mission-driven **Associate Director of Special Education (IEP and 504’s)** to join us in support of our growing School. The ideal candidate is fully dedicated to the mission of NCHS and to supporting the success of our students and families. This person will report directly to the **Director of Inclusive Learning** and be responsible for **socio-emotional and responsive academic programming.** ***Special Services***

* Support the Director of SPED in implementing a thorough, equitable, and compliant special services program.
* Establish and maintain and IEP case management system
* Prepare student IEPs for annual reviews, re-evaluations, initials and develop accountability measures for Teacher Reports.
* Analyze academic data to contribute to leading a proactive RTI process.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to meet the specialized needs of students.
* Provide IEP summaries to teachers and support teaching teams to devise and monitor high-impact support plans for students.
* Collaborate with the school nurse in managing and overseeing the implementation of 504s to ensure students receive appropriate accommodations to access the same educational opportunities as their peers.
* Collaborate with the Enrollment Department in updating all systems that reflect students’ IEP data (i.e ATS, SESIS)
* Prepare for, schedule and Lead IEP meetings

***Student Culture***

* Model strong, mutually respectful relationships with students and families and support teachers to do the same
* In collaboration with Associate Director of Student Experience and Safety, support Tier 2 and Tier 3 behavior interventions and evaluate student data to measure progress
* Observe and give feedback on schoolwide systems and classroom culture

**Candidate Requirements:**

* Bachelors Degree
* Degree in Special Education and Special Education Certification Required
* At least 2 years of teaching experience in a diverse by design environment preferred
* Experience in teaching and managing supports for students with IEPs and other special needs
* Prior experience directly managing, observing, and coaching teachers
* Exceptionally strong organizational skills, with a keen attention to detail
* Adept at collaborating and building community with others

*The critical features of this job are described above; they may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.*

title: Direct Support Professional Day Services
description:
Description:
**Job Purpose:**


The role involves supervising, guiding, and advocating for individuals with developmental disabilities, adhering to a structured schedule of volunteer, recreational, and life skills activities within a community setting. The required schedule is Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

**Essential Functions:**

* Provide Day Habilitation Services in person, following DDD, DOH, CDC, and state and local guidelines.
* Supervise program participants in line with their service plan's supervision guidelines (which may include line-of-sight supervision) during both facility and community-based activities.
* Engage in all scheduled activities with participants, including swimming, exercise, skill-building, gardening/farming, fishing, domestic tasks such as laundry and dishwashing, and various outdoor activities.
* Safely transport individuals to volunteer sites in an agency vehicle, adhering to the speed limits and guidelines outlined in the Our House, Inc. Safe Driving Policy, which includes driving on highways and over long distances.
* Maintain the appropriate ratio as specified in each individual's service plan during both facility and community-based activities.
* Ensure the cleanliness, safety, and security of the program site, which includes performing general cleaning tasks as necessary.
* Assist with participants' toileting needs, which may involve changing adult incontinence products/feminine hygiene products, cleaning after bowel movements or urination, and cleaning the surrounding area after accidents.
* Attend and contribute to monthly staff meetings and quarterly all-agency staff meetings.
* Demonstrate flexibility by working with various program participants and at different program sites as needed.


Requirements:
**Qualifications:**

* Must possess a high school diploma or equivalent.
* Must have valid driver's license with good driving record.
* Upon employment must pass all mandatory Division of Developmental Disabilities trainings and maintain current certification in First Aid and CPR, Handle with Care, and other trainings as required by Our House, Inc., the Department.
* Must be able to provide Professional References during the Application Process

**Travel Requirements:**

* Up to 90% of the workday may include travel. This is subject to change based on program and/or agency needs.

**Essential Physical/Mental Demands:**

* Shall not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of other individuals in the community residence or the OHI Administrative Offices.
* Must be able to write and type legibly utilizing a laptop, computer or other company device.
* Must be able to comprehend/interpret charts, diagrams, possess inductive and deductive reasoning.
* Must be able to physically enter programs and community buildings.
* Must be able to observe, hear and respond if a participant in the program or in the community is in danger or needs assistance.
* Must be able to physically demonstrate how to perform various tasks to participants.
* Must possess adequate motor skills to assist participants who are physically disabled, to be able to respond quickly to prevent injury or mishap of residents, create a safe atmosphere, and to be able to redirect participants with behavior problems. (Examples: self-abuse/injury, darting into dangerous situations, injuring other participants or other people)
* Must possess adequate reading and writing skills to complete all trainings and required written assignments.
* Must possess good judgment and problem-solving skills to handle day-to-day situations that may arise during work time.
* Must be able to work alone, while also meeting required staffing ratio.
* Must be able to accompany and supervise residents on appointments, community activities, recreational events, etc.
* Must have sufficient oral communication and comprehension skills to sufficiently understand and respond to other individuals including participants, both in person and on the telephone.
* Employee’s initials indicate that this page has been read and reviewed.
* Must be able to attend off-site trainings.
* Must be able to physically assist residents with meeting hygiene needs which includes, but is not limited to: showering, bathing and toileting.
* Must be able to physically assist individuals utilizing wheelchairs in a residential and community setting (pushing, transporting, etc.)
* Must be able to provide the adequate level of assistance to transfer participants in and out of the bathroom, bed, shower, etc. based on the needs of the residents in the home.
* Must wear PPE, including masks when required.
* Must be able to drive participants on a regular basis and complete business errands utilizing an agency vehicle.

**Lift/Force Requirement Weight**


Constant 10 lbs.


Frequent 25 lbs.


Occasional 50 lbs.

**Americans with Disabilities Act Requirements:**


Environment Demands and Exposures to Hazards: Normal work routine involves potential exposure to blood, tissues, body fluid, air/surface borne infections and chemicals. Must be familiar with Our House Inc.’s “Infection Control Policy & Procedure”. Must also attend agency’s annual training which provides information on “Infection Control Procedures”. American with Disabilities Act Statement: External and internal applicants as well as position incumbents who become disabled, must be able to perform the essential job specific functions either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation, to be determined by the organization on a case by case basis.

**Disclosure:**


Although Our House Inc. has attempted to accurately and thoroughly describe this position, Our House Inc. reserves the right to change the same, including to change, add to, or subtract from the duties outlined, within the sole discretion of Our House Inc., at any time, with or without advance notice. This job description in no way implies that these are the only duties, including essential duties, to be performed by the employee occupying this position. This job description is not an employment contract, implied or otherwise. The employment relationship remains “at-will”. The aforementioned job requirements are subject to change to reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Slime Experience Ambassador
description:
**About Sloomoo Institute**
===========================

  

Sloomoo Institute is a rapidly growing interactive experience based on play, #satisfying through handmade slime, tapping into the senses, and ASMR. We are an art-inspired, immersive haven of color, design, and joy. Launched in 2019, Sloomoo Institute now has 4 locations and has been an enormous success, attracting over 1 million guests and billions of media impressions. A fifth flagship will be opening in LA in the late summer/early fall. Even more, slime play is known to support stress relief as much as it does your imagination! Driven by a mission to provide a reprieve from the chaos of the world and screen addiction, the brand has close ties to mental health non-profits and a dedication to inclusion as well as supporting neurodiversity through our experience and our workforce.**Position Summary**
====================

  

The Slimetender is the most critical role to the venue and plays a leading role in the daily operation and management of Sloomoo Institute creating an inclusive culture and a warm welcome for our guests, volunteers, and team members. As a slimetender you will be trained on multiple stations and will “own” each station as necessary. You will bring a positive and empowering attitude to the team, and your motivating approach will ensure delivery to a high standard across the site. You will be able to work with a diverse group of slimetenders and demonstrate leadership, flexibility, and a proactive and diplomatic approach to problem-solving and the overall guest experience.**Responsibilities:**
=====================

* Ensure the policies & procedures of each experience is operating to standard, enabling guests to move efficiently through each experience and have a GREAT time while doing so.
* Scan and redeem tickets within the experience, keeping account for room capacity and guest flow.
* Enthusiastically host & operate various attractions within Sloomoo Institute, including games, experiences, photo ops, and challenges, all while serving as a personable, approachable, positive personality for all guests at all times.
* Occasional upkeep/cleaning of experience-specific props attractions in alignment with design team specifications, reporting any deficiencies to relevant managers.
* Provide world class guest service to our guests, facilitating guest feedback and concerns to management as necessary.
* Maintain brand integrity throughout the experience as well as outside Sloomoo.
* Identify, report, and log any damage or repairs.
* Ability to work a consistent schedule including weekends, evenings, and holidays.
* Delivering high-level experiences by engaging with guests.
* Being an ambassador of the Sloomoo Brand throughout the site.
* Ensure that safety is the top priority at the institute.
* Always smiling and delivering excellent guest service at all times.
* Support team members as necessary.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**
===================

* High school diploma or equivalent
* At least 6+ months of previous professional experience in the guest service, entertainment/events, theme park, hotel, amusement park or hospitality industry preferred.
* High energy, bubbly, people-loving personality
* Passionate about working with families/children.
* Ability and/or comfort to work in large-group environments with multiple staff and up to several dozen guests at a time.
* Great guest service attitude
* Ability to handle difficult situations.
* Enjoys working with families/children.
* Strong attention to detail

**Inclusivity Commitment:**
===========================


Sloomoo Institute is a company that respects and welcomes the uniqueness of each employee and offers everyone the means to find their place and thrive. We are committed to equal employment opportunities, career development opportunities and promoting initiatives aimed at creating a culture that is meaningful, innovative, and successful. Sloomoo Institute does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with neurodiversity or a disability or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Associate, Latin American Private Credit
description:
Join our Fixed Income Latin American Private Credit team in a client-facing, revenue generating role. In this role, you will leverage your credit skills and help us continue to grow our structured credit portfolio and provide innovative financing solutions for our Latin American clients.  

  

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.
What role will you play?  

Working within a fast-paced environment, you will enjoy a varied role where no day will be the same. Your focus will be on the credit analysis and execution of private credit transactions focused on infrastructure, energy, oil and gas and telecom across the Latam region, as well as credit underwriting to support US derivatives transactions.  

  

Salary range for this position: $117,000 - $175,000/Year. Actual base salary may vary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience, time in role, peer and market data, prior performance, business sector, and geographic location. You may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive compensation award. We offer a full spectrum of benefits, including Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental, Vision, Health Savings Account, Dependent Day Care Savings Account, Life Insurance, Disability and Other Insurance Plans, Paid Time Off (including Sick Leave, Parental Leave and Vacation), Holidays, 401(k), and Short/Long Term Disability, in addition to other special perks reserved for our employees.  

  

What you offer  

* Several years of experience covering Latin America in investment banking, structuring or credit.
* A strong technical lending or investment background with the understanding of financial analysis, structuring, documentation, and execution of debt transactions.
* Fluency in Spanish or Portuguese with familiarity of local regulations and markets in Mexico, Chile, Colombia, and Peru.
* Education in a quantitative discipline.
* Flexibility and willingness to work outside of regular business hours and travel in region.
#LI-EF1 #LI-Hybrid
We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.
About Commodities and Global Markets  

In Commodities and Global Markets you will be part of a global business offering capital and financing, risk management, market access, physical execution and logistics solutions to a diverse client base.
Benefits  

Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria, include:  

* Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
* One wellbeing leave day per year and minimum 25 days of annual leave
* Primary caregivers are eligible for 20 weeks paid leave along with 12 days of transition leave upon return to work and 6 weeks paid leave for secondary caregivers
* Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
* Range of benefits to support your physical, psychological and financial wellbeing
* Employee Assistance Program, a robust behavioural health network with counselling and coaching services
* Recognition and service awards


Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion  

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity and inclusion. As an inclusive employer, Macquarie does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, race (including color and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief.

title: Commercial Sales Consultant
description:
Description:

All American Ford in Old Bridge is one of the top dealerships in the U.S. and we are hiring! We currently have an open positions for experienced Commercial Sales Consultants. We are looking for a highly motivated, career driven individual to join our team. There is a great demand for new & used cars and we are looking for enthusiastic and determined professionals to represent our dealership. This position calls for an individual with strong work ethics, determined to excel in this industry and wants to be a part of the All American Family!

**All American Ford in Old Bridge has been awarded a TopWorkplaces 2023 honor by The NJ.com Top Workplaces. We're the #4 ranked Small Company to work for in NJ and #1 dealership in New Jersey.**

**Responsibilities:**

* Sales consultant is responsible for selling new and pre-owned vehicles at dealership gross profit, volume, and customer satisfaction standards.
* Recognize that our business is built on maintaining outstanding relationships with our customers and maintain the excellent service satisfaction that All American is well known for.
* Staying updated on vehicle specs such as make, model, trim levels, conditions and features, as well as the warranty status of our vehicles.
* Maintaining high CSI scores and following up on all sales leads,
* Staying updated on our current and incoming inventory.

* Present new and pre-owned vehicles to customers that fit their desires, including offering test drives.
* Introduce customers to our service and parts departments to ensure customer satisfaction after the sales process has been completed.

* Employee Discount/Pricing Benefits

* Volume Bonuses
* Large opportunity for growth 8 locations in our auto group!
* Blue Advantage Certified Used Center

* A professional and respectful work environment

There is plenty of opportunity for growth and long term careers here. Please apply for further details. We look forward to speaking with you!

title: Event Sales Coordinator
description:
For over three decades, ÉLAN FLOWERS has served as an inspired standard in an ever-changing floral industry. As an established design house with long standing relationships, our bespoke retail, event, and private/corporate subscription services communicate to the personal taste and vision of each of our clients, with élan: energy, style and panaché!

Equal parts quality and integrity, we pride ourselves in using the freshest flowers that speak directly to the season, while keeping our design consistent to ÉLAN FLOWERS classic aesthetic with a contemporary twist. Our floral studio in TRiBeCa also serves as a beautifully curated retail boutique, which allows for a truly delightful experience for the senses, that we hope to share with you.

**Purpose of Job**

As an Event Sales Coordinator for Élan Flowers you must be an event professional who is passionate about flowers. You will be a key representative of our elegant brand. You will assist clients and coordinate with Élan staff, venues, and outside vendors to ensure that all aspects of event sales are completed to the client’s satisfaction. You will balance tasks in a busy environment and help designers and support staff to give the bespoke service that our upscale clients expect.

THIS IS NOT A FLORAL DESIGN POSITION

**Job Duties and Responsibilities**

* Take proactive measures to manage and grow/cultivate both new & old client relationships by negotiating and managing client expectations & satisfaction
* Manage & oversee inquiries, coordination, and logistics of events orders
* Represent Elan Flowers within industry organizations and at networking opportunities
* Work with marketing lead to create marketing plans & timelines which include emails, partnerships, promotions & more
* Listen to clients earnestly in order to understand their event needs and desired aesthetics while encouraging a floral vision aligned with Elan’s brand, and exceed client’s expectations
* Schedule site & design meetings (in person and over the phone) necessary for events
* Source materials and supplies for event elements as needed; sustain high quality design aesthetic alongside budget management
* Coordinate with venues and vendors in order to provide highest quality service for clients
* Draft floral design proposals with detailed pricing and options to clients; Actively participate in sales meetings and presentations to promote Elan's designs and services
* Lead setup and installation of event elements on-site at NYC venues as needed
* Manage & process final invoicing for event clients and work with Elan’s accountant to align payments from clients and to vendors
* Collect and present feedback for event debriefings along with cataloging photos and notes

**Required Qualifications and Skills**

* Minimum of 2 years of experience in event sales in the floral industry
* Thorough knowledge of florals as relates to enhancing events & eagerness to learn Elan’s style and brand
* This position does NOT perform floral design, but prior experience is advantageous
* Outstanding customer service skills and effectively communicate with kindness, confidence, and respect even during periods of high stress and sensitivity
* Proficient in Google and Microsoft software applications; capable of learning and utilizing proprietary POS/CRM software and navigating multiple software platforms simultaneously
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, balance rapidly-shifting priorities, and meet tight deadlines while maintaining a positive attitude
* Strong attention to detail, problem solving, and multitasking
* Physically capable of standing or walking for extended periods, and moderate lifting

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Familiarity with a graphic design platform tool such as Canva or Photoshop

**Working Conditions and Compensation**

* Elan Flowers is located at 1 Worth Street, but requires travel for site visits, consultations, installations, and strikes
* Flexible schedule of ~40 hours/week, including expected overtime during Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, & Labor Day weeks; nights and weekends may be required as determined by event details
* Benefits include: Paid Time Off; Paid Holidays; employer-sponsored Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance; 401k Plan with employer matching; Commuter FSA

Only candidates with relevant experience will be considered, and contacted for sample proposals.

**Full-Time Benefits:**

* Paid Time Off, including paid holidays
* Health insurance with company contribution
* Dental and Vision insurance with company contribution
* 401k with up to 3.5% company match
* Company-administered Commuter Flexible Spending Account
* NY City/State mandated benefits: Paid sick leave, paid family leave, disability pay

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Evenings as needed
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Morning shift
* Nights as needed
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Floral sales for events: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Quality Assurance Coordinator
description:
Description:

Weiss-Aug Group is an internationally recognized leader in precision metal stamping, injection molding, value-added assembly solutions and tooling.


At our Corporate Headquarters we have served the medical device industry, automotive industry, and industrial sector for over 50 years. Our vision as a company is to create an exciting environment that will attract and retain the finest people committed to manufacturing creative and innovative components and products.


Join our team where every day we push the boundaries of manufacturing technology.


Our highly respected precision metal stamping and injection molding company is seeking a Quality Assurance Coordinator who will report on completing the training records, writing, issue, and distribution of document control forms. Also, support the quality and manufacturing areas in writing quality forms, quality alerts, and work instructions.

**Responsibilities:**

* Create, control, revise, maintain training records, skill records under the direction of the Director of Quality Assurance, for the East Hanover location.
* Write, issue, distribute and file document control forms (DCF). Prepare various documents, coordinate, and revise, maintain and facilitate understanding of the DCF’s. (EHA) Document control, distribution of notifications using email template (FFD)
* Coordinate the retaining process of documentation or final product samples, interact with archiving outside vendor for pick-up, complete documentation as needed, maintain the logs and be able to explain to auditors and other external visitors our retaining procedures (EHA, FFD).
* Maintain company document control system, by helping with the revisions and maintenance of the documentation, master control lists, in relation to the training records. Issue Company metrics every quarter (EHA)
* ISO 13485 audits of ISO procedures, processes, product audit control (EHA, FFD)
* Create, control, revise, maintain training records, skill records under the direction of the Quality Assurance, for the Fairfield location.
* Supplier communication for SCAR’s follow-up with vendors.
* MRB communication, DPD weekly reports (EHA)
* Processing scrap in PLEX (EHA)


Requirements:
* Minimum of 2 years community college or equivalent, in administration, engineering, or business.
* Very Good knowledge of Excel and Word software.
* Requires verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate correctly information and technical data to people of various degrees of ability. Knowledge or previous experience with documentation, compliance regulations, or specifications and procedures.
* Strong organizational ability, sense of urgency, project management skills, and quality consciousness.

title: Front Desk Coordinator (Part Time)
description:
Description:

Metro Physical & Aquatic Therapy is a comprehensive multidisciplinary company who offers Physical, Occupational, Speech Therapy, Massage and Acupuncture services. We take great pride in inspiring our team to create an everlasting bond with our patients, our doctors, and our community. But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are driven by our mission to continually invest in our people and offer the best workplace environment possible.

**Metro Physical & Aquatic Therapy has immediate opening for Front Desk Receptionists!** **Come be a part of a growing organization in a progressive, supportive, and innovative team!**


Are you looking for an exciting opportunity in a fast-growing industry? Do you want to make a difference in people's lives while you grow your career? Are you interested in delivering compassion, excellence, and reliable service to patients? We want you to apply your energy and skills t become an integral part of a caring, professional team that provides the highest quality care to our patients.

**Schedule: M-Th 4pm-8pm Saturday Hybrid 8am-2pm**

**Essential Functions:**

* Welcomes patients and visitors with an upbeat attitude and a warm and inviting smile - in person or on the telephone; answering or referring inquiries.
* Demonstrate a high level of customer service at all times. Patient’s satisfaction, provider time, and treatment room utilization by scheduling appointments in person or by telephone.
* Generate a compilation of reports, logs and lists including but not limited to authorization and verifications with a high level of accuracy.
* Ensure co-pays are tallied and reconciled and control credit extended to patients.
* Call treating physicians to obtain updated prescriptions for treatment by Occupational and Physical Therapists.
* Obtains Plan of Cares from treating physician and update system.
* Set up a new /returning patient case in Theraoffice which includes obtaining new demographic information and all existing insurance information.
* Keeps patient appointments on schedule by notifying Clinicians of patient’s arrival; reviewing service delivery compared to schedule; reminding provider of service delays.
* Ensures availability of treatment information by filing and retrieving patient records.
* Maintains business office inventory and equipment by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed supplies; placing and expediting orders for supplies; verifying receipt of supplies; scheduling equipment service and repairs.
* Maintains a working knowledge of Metro, rules and policies, and works to ensure the compliance with the stated parameters. Perform other duties and assignments as required.
* Maintains strictest confidentiality; adheres to all HIPAA guidelines/regulations.
* Perform other duties and assignments as required.


Requirements:
* One (1) year of Physical Therapy/Medical office experience
* Experience with a EMR System a plus
* Ability to communicate to customers, co-workers and management in a professional/courteous manner.
* Current or recent experience in a medical practice assuring compliance with federal, state and local regulations and guidelines.
* Must work well within a team environment.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
* Proficiency in the Google Suite platform and ability to learn new programs quickly.
* One year of experience in a customer service-oriented is strongly desired.
* High school diploma or GED is required
company_description: Metro Physical & Aquatic Therapy is one of the largest family-owned and operated Rehabilitation practices on Long Island, with a newfound presence in Westchester, Connecticut, and Rhode Island!

title: Director, Portfolio and Launch Management
description:
Description:**SUMMARY:**
============


Zydus Pharmaceuticals (USA) Inc. is seeking a candidate with experience in portfolio management within the generics pharmaceutical industry to join our team in Pennington, NJ. This role will be responsible for managing Zydus’ portfolio, taking products from the nomination stage through commercialization. The position will report directly to the VP of Marketing and Sales Operations*.* This exciting opening offers the candidate the opportunity to be a part of a professional, customer-focused, pharmaceutical company with a competitive salary and full benefits package. Title may be negotiable based on experience.


Zydus Pharmaceuticals (USA) Inc. is a globally integrated generic pharmaceutical company with a focus on providing high service, quality, and affordable products. Our US leadership, which has over 60 years of US generic market experience, understands the customer’s business which allows Zydus the ability to provide unique models to help drive their customer’s success. Our parent company, Zydus Lifesciences, has a large presence in global markets, including relationships with many top tier international pharmaceutical companies. Based on a manufacturing and development history that spans over 50 years, it is the 4th largest pharmaceutical company in India.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**
=====================

* Manage Zydus’ 505(b)(2) and biosimilar portfolio; develop and assist with executing go-to-market strategies for the company’s non-traditional generics
* Prepare and maintain business cases for Zydus’ 505(b)(2) and biosimilar portfolio
* Identify new generic product opportunities for US market by utilizing information and competitive intelligence gathered through databases, analyst reports, and information provided by teams within Zydus
* Coordinate on and monitor new product prioritization for products from pre-filing through launch
* Manage transition from portfolio products to new product launch planning
* Utilize databases such as IQVIA to evaluate product opportunities, identify key trends, and monitor the competitive landscape of Zydus’ portfolio
* Determine the viability of new product opportunities, providing feedback to support Go/No Go product decisions
* Continuously evaluate Zydus portfolio to identify areas of risk and opportunity
* Manage product initiation form procedures and processes, including recommending and approving trade dress as well as approving costs of development
* Maintain accurate forecasts for products within the portfolio
* Support and participate in monthly R&D meetings
* Continuously explore ways to streamline and improve current processes and tools
* Understand industry standards, Zydus policies, processes, and business standards
* Perform other related duties and ad hoc responsibilities as required


Requirements:**QUALIFICATIONS – SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:**
===========================================

* Excellent Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills required
* Extensive experience with IQVIA preferred
* Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment
* Ability to prioritize and work well within a dynamic environment
* Self-starter who can be effective with minimal supervision
* Analytical with a keen attention to detail
* Strong communication skills
* Ability to grasp concepts and ideas quickly and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Quantitative mindset
* Ability to resolve complex issues both autonomously and in a team environment

**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:**
===========================

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
* Pharmaceutical/generics experience preferred

**TRAVEL:**
===========

* Limited

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**
=====================


This is an office-based position, located in our office in Pennington, NJ. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the individual is:

* Frequently required to sit and/or stand, walk, talk, and hear.
* Ability to sit at a computer for an extended period of time.
* Vision ability requirements include clarity of visions at 20 inches or less due to computer work.
* Moderate noise (i.e., background noise due to computers, phone, printers, and light hallway traffic).
* Constantly required to use hands and fingers to operate office machines and equipment.
* Frequently required to reach with hands and arms. Occasionally required to stoop, kneel, and crouch.


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that an individual encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

title: Middle School Science Teacher
description:
**FOLLOW YOUR PASSION**

Are you looking to make a BIG impact? At Zeta, we pursue an unprecedented combination of high academic achievement and social-emotional development for our students. We insist that every student receives a world-class education while fostering a love for learning. We are passionate about changing the landscape of public education in New York City and beyond, and we are uncompromising in our mission.

Currently, we operate multiple elementary and middle schools in the **Bronx and Upper Manhattan**. We plan to grow and open 1-2 schools each year because children in *every* community deserve excellent, equitable education. Join our growing team today, and be a change agent for children.

**DELIVER POWERFUL RESULTS**

To achieve our vision, we are searching for **Middle School Science Teachers** with a **Bachelor’s degree** (STEM field preferred) and **at least 1-2+ years of lead teaching experience** (NY certification preferred), with a proven record of propelling extraordinary student growth.

**Responsibilities:**

– Plan inquiry-based, academically rigorous science lessons that inspire curiosity in all students

– Build a classroom culture that fosters students’ genuine love for learning and creates a sense of community for our families

– Internalize Zeta’s science scope and sequence to see how concepts build upon each other throughout the year

– Use data-driven approach and teaching resources to drive student achievement

– Serve as an Advisor to a small group of students and develop authentic, meaningful relationships with students and families in service of students’ personal and academic growth

– Collaborate with colleagues and participate in weekly professional development with leaders to benefit from feedback and planning that will help you grow as an educator

**JOIN OUR PURPOSE-DRIVEN COMMUNITY**

Zeta teammates are lifelong learners who live with child-like joy and a deep sense of purpose. We disrupt the status quo and tackle problems together. Our team stands united by our commitment to a limitless future for every child. Our Zeta team is comprised of top talent with incredible schooling and private sector experience. At Zeta:

– We are passionate about our mission of providing world-class education to all students

– We bring a mindset of growth, flexibility, and openness to feedback

– We are hungry and determined to not only meet our goals, but surpass them

– We are humble, willing to put the team’s needs ahead of our own, and committed to contributing to a collaborative work environment

– We have a high bar for excellence and sweat over the details

– We are caring and put team over individual at all times

**The start date for this position is rolling through Fall 2024.** The salary range for this position is between $62,000 and $106,000 and we are currently offering a $5,000 signing bonus. New hires can expect to be brought into the organization at a salary at or near the start of the range, depending on relevant experience teaching in a lead capacity in a school, NYS teacher certification status, and internal equity. Compensation is based on our salary scales.

**HOW DOES ZETA INVEST IN YOU?**

**We offer great benefits:**

– Comprehensive and affordable medical, dental, and vision plans

– Flexible spending accounts for eligible medical purchases and commuter expenses

– 403(b) retirement plan; Zeta offers matching contributions toward your savings

– Competitive compensation

- $5,000 Signing Bonus

**We provide awesome perks:**

– MacBook Air

– Zeta swag

– Specified monthly reimbursement for use of mobile phone

– Fully stocked teacher workrooms with favorite snacks and Nespresso machine

– NYC’s finest sweet treats

– Team outings

**We care deeply about your personal and professional growth:**

– Clear pathway to professional growth

– Consistent feedback and support from managers and teammates

– Community Circle practice to build and strengthen our sense of team

– Interactive Mindfulness and DEIJ programming

**APPLY NOW!**

Equity is at the heart of our mission. We have a deep commitment to pursuing diversity and striving for equity. Zeta is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Work authorization is required (candidate must have permanent authorization to work in the U.S.).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $62,000.00 - $106,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Charter school

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* How many years of lead teaching experience do you have?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

License/Certification:

* New York State Teaching Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Mixed Methods Researcher (Research Coadjutant)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Mixed Methods Researcher (Research Coadjutant)
  

**Department** SMLR - Dean's Office
  

**Salary** Commensurate With Experience
  

**Posting Summary**
The Education and Employment Research Center in the School of Management and Labor Relations at Rutgers University seeks a part-time mixed methods researcher for work on higher education and workforce development research projects. This researcher would help design and execute evaluation plans for various projects and produce analysis for reporting.
  

**Responsibilities include:**
* Contribute to the design, execution, and interpretation of social science, experimental, survey research, and other studies with a focus on mixed research methodologies.
* Conduct interviews with a range of respondents including students, higher education and workforce leaders, and employers.
* Perform coding and analysis using NVivo qualitative data management software.
* Conduct study procedures using quasi-experimental methods,
* Analyze data in Microsoft Excel, SPSS, SAS and/or STATA.
* Prepare written reports, sections for academic publication, technical reports, presentations, and external communications summarizing research methods, findings, and implications.
* Coordinate with internal teams to support projects.
* Effectively communicate research methods and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Assist with development of proposals and work plans.
* Potentially travel to visit research sites in the field.

  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Posting Number** 24FA0857
  

**Posting Open Date** 08/26/2024
  

**Posting Close Date** 09/03/2024
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Master or Doctoral degree in a social science discipline.
* Minimum of three years of academic or professional research experience required.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Strong quantitative ability, including knowledge of quasi-experimental methods, and experience working with data in Microsoft Excel, SPSS, SAS and/or STATA.
* Experience with Qualtrics survey development and administration.
* Experience in conducting education and/or workforce research.
* Experience with federal survey systems and national datasets is a plus.
* Demonstration of strong verbal and written communications skills.
* Ability to work well with others, as well as independently and under minimal supervision.
* Strong quantitative and qualitative research abilities.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* This position’s duties are normally performed in a typical interior work environment, based on the activity scheduled.
* No or very limited exposure to physical risk.
* Must be available during weekdays. Weekend and evening opportunities may occur. Travel to project sites may be required.
* Travel to project sites within the US may be required.


  

**Overview**
This position is up to 20 hours per week. Position duration depends on project needs.
  

**Statement**
  

Posting Details
